channel.title: Restoring a flash drive
channel.description: I just plugged my flash drive into my windows computer to place my server backup on it when everything on it was erased. I have photos on there that are from 1999 - 2003. Those pictures were on an older computer that I was thinking about resetting and selling but thank God I didn't. All that saved was 1 .zip file and its empty. The flash drive says there's only 600MB of space out of 4GB left, which is how it was before anything was deleted. Norton (don't comment about norton, it came with my computer as a free 60 day full trial thing, I don't see why not) wanted to scan the folder so I say okay whatever and it says it found a virus, which was the server restarter of course, and asked to remove it. I clicked yes, it's just an auto-restarter who cares if I lose it. It resets everything.. I plug the flash drive into my Ubuntu computer and it finds a folder with over 8,000 files in it that I can't see on Windows. So yeah, is there any way to restore a flash drive? Thanks.

item.title: Restoring a flash drive
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Try deleting the partition(s) with gparted, then create a new partition and specify it as the full capacity. Best formatting/partitioning application out there.

Read full topic

item.title: Restoring a flash drive
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

SilentCJ:

Just try taking the files off through ubuntu, then full format the stick, and put them back on it then try on windows again.

The whole thing is fucked up.
Is there any way to completely reset the flash drive? I deleted everything on it and it still says only 600MB of free space out of 4GB.

Read full topic

item.title: Restoring a flash drive
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Just try taking the files off through ubuntu, then full format the stick, and put them back on it then try on windows again.

Read full topic

item.title: Restoring a flash drive
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

CoonHunter:

The folders might be set to hidden. Or try to copy them to the windows partition using ubuntu,

I have view hidden files set to on. The computer is solely Ubuntu, there’s no Windows. I have 2 separate desktops, 1 is Windows the other is Ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Restoring a flash drive
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The folders might be set to hidden. Or try to copy them to the windows partition using ubuntu,
